channel.title: How do I DELETE objects?!?!?!??!?!?!??!!?!?!?!?!?!?!???! HURRY TO ANSWER PLEASE!
channel.description:
Okay It helped, But now I have to figure out how to delete objects.. There's a Potted plant and Coordinates it says (1158) (3029,3378)
I searched for (3029, 3378) and (3029,3378) and client.java but it didn't find anything.. I tried with some other items and it wont work.. I know that I'm a noob ATM but to become a nonnoob.. I have to learn. :)
Thanks ~ Exotz.

item.title: How do I DELETE objects?!?!?!??!?!?!??!!?!?!?!?!?!?!???! HURRY TO ANSWER PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @Zuno Zuno
item.description:
@Zuno wrote:

[quote=“Extoz, post:1, topic:223330”]Okay It helped, But now I have to figure out how to delete objects… There’s a Potted plant and Coordinates it says (1158) (3029,3378)

I searched for (3029, 3378) and (3029,3378) and client.java but it didn’t find anything… I tried with some other items and it wont work…
I know that I’m a noob ATM but to become a nonnoob… I have to learn.

Thanks ~ Exotz.[/quote]

Mini tut time. Lol.

Open client.java and search for:

        deletethatobject(

Now this is an exapmple deletethatobject code:

        deletethatobject(0, 0); // Furniture

All you have to do is copy and paste the code above into the deletethatobject list and then change the 0, 0 to the X Y coordinates to the object that you want deleted. optional Next change " // Furniture" to the name of what you are deleting, I recomend this so if you want to “undelete” this item you can just erase the code. optional

Hope I could help.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I DELETE objects?!?!?!??!?!?!??!!?!?!?!?!?!?!???! HURRY TO ANSWER PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @I_Buck_I I Buck I
item.description:
@I_Buck_I wrote:

easy, go into client.java and search for:

makeGlobalObject

in that there will be tons or little depending on what the base person used.

here is an example of one:

makeGlobalObject(2654, 2590, 5276, -3, 10);//Main Bank

The first id would be the object id, the second two id’s are the coordinates, and the -3 is what way it is facing.

Hope that helped.
